comments.creator: brock@10twebdesign.com
comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
Build Identifier: 4.0

The background image will not display in combination with border-radius (or -moz-border-radius).  If radius CSS is removed, image displays properly.  Only appears to be an issue with Linux build, as Windows 7 (and Android) both display the background image properly with the border-radius.

Reproducible: Always

comments.author: tnikkel@gmail.com
comments.raw_text: Where did you get your Linux build? Is it using system cairo or in-tree cairo? Could it be something specific to your machine?
comments.creator: tnikkel@gmail.com
comments.text: Where did you get your Linux build? Is it using system cairo or in-tree cairo? Could it be something specific to your machine?

comments.author: brock@10twebdesign.com
comments.text: I'm running openSuSE 11.1, cairo version is 1.8.0 from the openSuSE repositories.
comments.creator: brock@10twebdesign.com
comments.raw_text: I'm running openSuSE 11.1, cairo version is 1.8.0 from the openSuSE repositories.

comments.author: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.text: Yes, but is that the cairo your Firefox is compiled against?  Last I checked, Firefox 4 requires cairo 1.10 or newer.
comments.creator: bzbarsky@mit.edu
comments.raw_text: Yes, but is that the cairo your Firefox is compiled against?  Last I checked, Firefox 4 requires cairo 1.10 or newer.

comments.text: Did you get your build from ftp.mozilla.org? Or was it provided by your distro? Compiled it yourself?

brock@10twebdesign.com
comments.text: It was provided through openSuse as a binary.  I just updated the cairo libraries to 1.10 just to be sure.  I also just grabbed the binary from mozilla.org, and it did not display properly with that build, either.
comments.creator: brock@10twebdesign.com
comments.raw_text: It was provided through openSuse as a binary.  I just updated the cairo libraries to 1.10 just to be sure.  I also just grabbed the binary from mozilla.org, and it did not display properly with that build, either.
Maybe it is something specific to your graphics driver or the version of X that you are using?
